t: “Wake*pn up, wake up; put*ln on your strength, Zion! Put*ln on your beautiful garments, Jerusalem,*ln the holy city! For*ln the uncircumcised and the unclean will*ln no longer enter you.
Stand*ln up, shake the dust off yourself! Take*ln your seat, Jerusalem. Remove*ln the bonds from your neck, captive*ln Daughter Zion.”
For*ln this is what the Lord*s says: “You*ln were sold for nothing, and*ln you will be redeemed without silver.”
For*ln this is what the Lord God*s says: “At*ln first my people went down to Egypt to reside there, then*ln Assyria oppressed them without cause.

So*ln now what have I here” — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — “that*pn my people are taken away for nothing? Its*ln rulers wail” — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — “and*pn my name is continually blasphemed all day long.
Therefore*ln my people will know my name; therefore*ln they will know on that day that*ln I am he who says, ‘Here*ln I am.’”
How*pn beautiful on the mountains are*ln the feet of the herald, who*ln proclaims peace, who*ln brings news of good things, who*ln proclaims salvation, who*ln says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
The*ln voices of your watchmen— they*ln lift up their voices, shouting*ln for joy together; for*ln every eye will see when*ln the Lord*s returns to Zion.
Be*ln joyful, rejoice together, you*ln ruins of Jerusalem! For*ln the Lord*s has comforted his people; he*ln has redeemed Jerusalem.
The*ln Lord*s has displayed his holy arm in*ln the sight of all the nations; all*ln the ends of the earth will see the*ln salvation of our God.
Leave,*pn leave, go out from there! Do*ln not touch anything unclean; go*ln out from her, purify yourselves, you*ln who carry the vessels of the Lord.*s
For*ln you will not leave in a hurry, and*ln you will not have to take flight; because*ln the Lord*s is going before you, and*ln the God of Israel is your rear guard.
See,*pn my servant will be successful; he*ln will be raised and lifted up and greatly exalted.
Just*ln as many were appalled at you— his*ln appearance was so disfigured that*ln he did not look like a man, and*ln his form did not resemble a human being —
so*ln he will sprinkle many nations. Kings*ln will shut their mouths because of him, for*ln they will see what had not been told them, and*ln they will understand what they had not heard.
